forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy, with a high near 26. Northeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 7 to 11 inches possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy, with a low around 20. Northeast wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 10 to 16 inches possible.

weather_report:
In Boston, the world has turned into a soft blanket of snow, the sky shrouded in a muted gray that feels both cozy and confining. This morning’s forecast promises not just a sprinkling, but a generous drape of white to envelop the city — a wintry embrace that both enchants and warns. The air is crisp, with the northeast wind nipping at exposed skin, driving home the necessity of warm layers. Those with work or errands may find themselves compelled to bundle up in thick scarves and sturdy boots, perhaps adorned with an extra pair of gloves, as they navigate the powdered streets.

As the day unfolds, the snow is set to continue its relentless descend, with a strong possibility of fresh accumulation. Tonight may see the temperature dipping slightly, compounded by gusts of wind that dance and swirl the falling flakes into whimsical patterns. Perhaps this is an invitation to settle in with a good book or a warm cup of tea, while watching the world transform into a picturesque scene worthy of a postcard. Given the delightfully bleak and blustery weather, a leisurely stroll to admire the quiet beauty of snow-laden trees might be in order, or perhaps a visit to a cozy café where the chatter of fellow patrons provides warmth against the chill. Embrace the charm of the day — but do so with the understanding that nature, in its grandeur, can be both inviting and intimidating.
